--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kathy Van Stone <kvs@a...> wrote:

> What you want to mock is probably the statement and connection, not the 
> result set (since you never need the result set to throw an 
> exception).  This should be easier to implement, but also check out 
> http://www.mockobjects.com/, which may do much of that work for you.

Yes, there are some pre-made mocks for JDBC stuff, including the
ability to throw exceptions.

If you do need to test handling of exceptions thown by ResultSet you
could try using a FactoryMethod to create the ResultSet.  In your
test, create a specialization of the class (as an anon inner class)
and override the FactoryMethod to create a MockResultSet (and setting
it up to throw the desired exception) and return that.

There was a good paper on this technique on DeveloperWorks:

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-mocktest.html

Dave
